text: Where has your beloved gone,
O most beautiful among women?
Where has your beloved turned
that we may seek him with you?
My beloved has gone down to his garden,
to the garden bed of the spice,
to pasture his flock and to gather lilies in the garden.

⸤I belong to my beloved and he belongs to me⸥;\f + \fr 6:3 \ft Literally “I for my beloved and he for me” \f*
he pastures his flock among the lilies.

You \add are\add* beautiful, my beloved, as Tirzah,
lovely as Jerusalem,

for they overwhelm me.
Your hair \add is\add* like a flock of the goats

Your teeth \add are\add* like a flock of the ewes
that have come up from the washing,
all of them bearing twins,

Your cheeks ⸤behind⸥\f + \fr 6:7 \ft Literally “from behind” \f* your veil

The Maiden’s Beauty Is without Peer
Sixty queens there \add are\add*, eighty concubines,
and maidens beyond number.
